Air Fryer Bacon Wrapped Asparagus

Jump to Recipe

If you're looking for a quick and delicious appetizer or side dish that will impress your family and friends, look no further than Air Fryer Bacon Wrapped Asparagus! This delightful recipe combines the earthy crunch of fresh asparagus with the savory, crispy goodness of bacon, creating a mouthwatering treat that’s sure to be a hit at any gathering. Not only is it easy to prepare, but using an air fryer means you can enjoy that crispy bacon texture without the excess oil of traditional frying. In just a matter of minutes, you can whip up this gourmet dish that is perfect for any occasion, from backyard barbecues to holiday feasts. Plus, with just a handful of simple ingredients like asparagus, bacon, olive oil, salt, and pepper, it’s a low-carb, keto-friendly option that caters to various dietary preferences. Let’s dive into this flavorful recipe that will elevate your culinary game!

Ingredients

asparagus

Choose fresh asparagus with firm stalks and closed tips. If you can't find asparagus, you can substitute it with green beans or zucchini. For preparation, wash thoroughly and snap off the woody ends, which will naturally break where the tender part begins.

bacon

Use thick-cut bacon for a meatier texture and better flavor. If you're looking for a healthier option, turkey bacon can be used, but it may not crisp up as well. For flavor enhancement, consider using flavored bacon like maple or peppered.

olive oil

Extra virgin olive oil is best for its rich flavor. If you're out of olive oil, avocado oil is a great substitute due to its high smoke point and similar flavor. Use just enough to coat the asparagus lightly to help the seasoning stick.

salt

Use kosher salt for a better texture and flavor distribution. If you're watching your sodium intake, try using a salt substitute or seasoning blends that contain no salt, like garlic powder or lemon zest.

pepper

Freshly ground black pepper adds a more vibrant flavor than pre-ground. If you want to elevate the dish, consider using a mix of different peppers (like white, pink, or green) for a more complex flavor profile.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Air Fryer

    Set your air fryer to 400°F (200°C) and allow it to preheat for about 5 minutes. Preheating ensures that the bacon gets crispy and the asparagus cooks evenly.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Asparagus

    Rinse the asparagus under cold water to remove any dirt. Trim the tough ends by holding each spear and bending it gently until it naturally snaps. This method ensures you remove the woody part.

  • Step 3: Wrap Asparagus with Bacon

    Take one slice of bacon and start wrapping it around the asparagus spear at the bottom, spiraling up towards the tip. Ensure the bacon overlaps slightly as you wrap for maximum flavor. If necessary, use a toothpick to secure the bacon in place.

  • Step 4: Season the Wrapped Asparagus

    Drizzle the bacon-wrapped asparagus with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. This helps the bacon crisp up in the air fryer. Sprinkle salt and pepper to taste; remember, bacon is already salty, so moderate the salt.

  • Step 5: Arrange in Air Fryer Basket

    Place the wrapped asparagus in a single layer in the air fryer basket. Avoid overcrowding the basket to ensure even cooking. If you have more than can fit, cook in batches.

  • Step 6: Cook the Asparagus

    Air fry the bacon-wrapped asparagus at 400°F (200°C) for 10 minutes. Check halfway through for doneness; if the bacon isn’t crispy enough, add a few more minutes.

  • Step 7: Serve and Enjoy

    Once cooked, remove the asparagus from the air fryer and let it cool for a minute or two. Serve warm as an appetizer or side dish.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare asparagus for cooking?

Start by washing the asparagus under cold water to remove any dirt. Then, trim the tough ends by bending each spear until it snaps—this will naturally break off the woody part.

What type of bacon should I use?

You can use any type of bacon you prefer, such as regular, thick-cut, or turkey bacon. Just keep in mind that cooking times may vary slightly with different types.

How do I know when the bacon is crispy?

You'll know the bacon is crispy when it has turned a golden brown color and feels firm to the touch. If you prefer extra crispy bacon, you can add an additional 2-3 minutes to the cooking time.

Do I need to preheat my air fryer?

Yes, preheating your air fryer helps to ensure even cooking. Set it to 400°F (200°C) and let it heat up for about 3-5 minutes before adding your food.

Can I use other vegetables instead of asparagus?

Absolutely! You can use other vegetables like green beans, zucchini, or bell peppers, but cooking times may vary. Adjust based on the thickness of the vegetable.

How can I make sure the bacon stays wrapped around the asparagus?

Start wrapping the bacon at the bottom of the asparagus spear and spiral it tightly towards the top. If needed, you can secure the ends with a toothpick.

What should I do if the bacon isn't cooking evenly?

If you notice uneven cooking, you can shake the air fryer basket halfway through the cooking time to ensure all pieces get equal heat.

How do I know when the asparagus is done?

The asparagus should be tender when pierced with a fork. It should also have a vibrant green color. If it looks dull or overly soft, it may be overcooked.

What can I serve with bacon-wrapped asparagus?

This dish pairs well with a variety of main courses, such as grilled chicken, steak, or fish. You could also serve it as a tasty appetizer at a gathering!

How do I clean my air fryer after cooking?

Let the air fryer cool down, then wipe the basket and the inside with a damp cloth or sponge. Most baskets are dishwasher safe, so check your manufacturer's instructions.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For dietary preferences, this dish can be made gluten-free and is naturally low-carb. For a vegetarian or vegan option, substitute bacon with plant-based bacon or tempeh bacon, keeping in mind that cooking times may vary. Additionally, using a low-sodium bacon can help cater to those watching their salt intake. Always check for allergens related to specific brands of bacon or sauces used.

Pairings

Pair the Air Fryer Bacon Wrapped Asparagus with a crisp white wine like Sauvignon Blanc or a light-bodied red such as Pinot Noir. For a non-alcoholic option, consider pairing with a refreshing sparkling water with a splash of lemon or lime. Serve as an appetizer alongside a charcuterie board featuring cheeses, cured meats, and olives to complement the savory flavors of the dish. If desired, add a dipping sauce such as a garlic aioli or a balsamic reduction for extra flavor.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the bacon-wrapped asparagus on a large platter garnished with fresh herbs, such as parsley or chives, for an elegant touch. Consider presenting with lemon wedges for a zesty squeeze right before eating. For a more casual gathering, place the asparagus in mason jars for easy handling or on skewers for a fun finger food option. Ensure the dish is served warm to maintain the crispy texture of the bacon and tenderness of the asparagus.

Description

Crispy bacon wrapped around tender asparagus, perfectly cooked in the air fryer for a deliciously easy appetizer or side dish!

Ingredients

  • asparagus: 1 bunch
  • bacon: 8 slices
  • olive oil: 1 tablespoon
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste
